alert.note: Alert for Aiken; Edgefield; Lexington; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 26 at 10:05PM EDT until March 26 at 10:30PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL EDGEFIELD...WEST CENTRAL LEXINGTON...NORTH CENTRAL AIKEN AND SOUTHEASTERN SALUDA COUNTIES... At 1005 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Edgefield County Airport, or 12 miles north of Aiken, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include... Batesburg-Leesville, Johnston, Ridge Spring, Aiken Municipal Airport, Edgefield County Airport, Aiken State Park, Monetta, Trenton, Ward, Hibernia, Kneece and New Holland. This includes Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 14 and 37. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows. Excessive cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
